messages.subject: File - Email for AlwaysLearning Members.txt
messages.msgSnippet: ﻿Posts for the Always Learning list need to fulfill at least one of these criteria: -helps lots of people understand unschooling -asks a question that
messages.messageBody:
���Posts for the Always Learning list need to fulfill at least one of these criteria:

-helps lots of people understand unschooling
-asks a question that actually needs an answer
-requests help seeing different aspects of a situation
-helps people have more peaceful and joyful lives (helps lots of people
on the list)

ALL posts should be

honest
proofread
sincere
clear

NO posts should be just a "thank you" or "me too" or "cool" or "LOL"

With over two thousand people we don't need greetings and good-byes. Be
here or don't be here, and save posting for important messages to
hundreds of people.

If you don't want to even consider what people are offering as
suggestions, keep that to yourself. THINK about what you've read.
Think privately, and not in a post that hundreds of people will need
to read or ignore. Only post important, useful, honest things.

Thanks,

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] File - Email for AlwaysLearning Members.txt
messages.msgSnippet: -=-With over two thousand people we don t need greetings and good-byes. Be here or don t be here, and save posting for important messages to hundreds of
messages.messageBody:
-=-With over two thousand people we don't need greetings and good-byes. Be
here or don't be here, and save posting for important messages to
hundreds of people.-=-

The count from yahoogroups is 4408.
It's okay not to leave our monthly reminder at "over two thousand." That's still true. And probably 1,000 of those members got what they came for and don't read anymore, or have changed e-mail addresses and forgot how to get here.

Even if we only had one thousand, though, it's better to think before posting whether it will be potentially beneficial to hundreds of people to read what you're writing.

-=-﻿Posts for the Always Learning list need to fulfill at least one of these criteria:

-helps lots of people understand unschooling
-asks a question that actually needs an answer
-requests help seeing different aspects of a situation
-helps people have more peaceful and joyful lives (helps lots of people
on the list)-=-

That means asking and answering questions is GOOD! :-)

Bringing a link to an article or video or book might be good IF the item will help unschoolers, and IF the poster explains why she/he believes it will be helpful. So don't drop an un-introduced link. That's not cool. Tell us the good parts and what got you excited about it.

Thanks for being here!

Sandra

With over two thousand people we don't need greetings and good-byes. Be
here or don't be here, and save posting for important messages to
hundreds of people.

If you don't want to even consider what people are offering as
suggestions, keep that to yourself. THINK about what you've read.
Think privately, and not in a post that hundreds of people will need
to read or ignore. Only post important, useful, honest things.

Thanks,

Sandra

messages.subject: File - Email for AlwaysLearning Members.txt
messages.msgSnippet: ﻿Posts for the Always Learning list need to fulfill at least one of these criteria: -helps lots of people understand unschooling -asks a question that
messages.messageBody:
���Posts for the Always Learning list need to fulfill at least one of these criteria:

-helps lots of people understand unschooling
-asks a question that actually needs an answer
-requests help seeing different aspects of a situation
-helps people have more peaceful and joyful lives (helps lots of people
on the list)

ALL posts should be

honest
proofread
sincere
clear

NO posts should be just a "thank you" or "me too" or "cool" or "LOL"

With over two thousand people we don't need greetings and good-byes. Be
here or don't be here, and save posting for important messages to
hundreds of people.

If you don't want to even consider what people are offering as
suggestions, keep that to yourself. THINK about what you've read.
Think privately, and not in a post that hundreds of people will need
to read or ignore. Only post important, useful, honest things.

Thanks,

Sandra
